headline.main: Conference Championship Probabilities, and How the Patriots Run

docs.snippet: The judge in the concussion settlement case took exception to a clause that would keep players who receive a cash payout from suing the N.C.A.A....
docs.lead_paragraph: The judge in the concussion settlement case took exception to a clause that would keep players who receive a cash payout from suing the N.C.A.A.
docs.abstract: Federal Judge Anita B Brody, rejecting $765 million NFL concussion lawsuit settlement on grounds that it might not cover all future players, also takes exception to clause that would preclude players who receive payout from suing the NCAA or amateur football organizations.

headline.main: In N.F.L. Suit, Judge Flags Provision Protecting N.C.A.A.

byline.original: By STEVE EDER and KEN BELSON

docs.snippet: This year, the challenges of securing the Super Bowl will extend far beyond the game site in East Rutherford, N.J., across state lines and multiple jurisdictions....
docs.lead_paragraph: This year, the challenges of securing the Super Bowl will extend far beyond the game site in East Rutherford, N.J., across state lines and multiple jurisdictions.
docs.abstract: Already difficult task of providing security for the Super Bowl will be even more complex in current season, as NFL prepares to turn large swath of Broadway in Manhattan into an open-air football festival called Super Bowl Boulevard; string of other events in Brooklyn, Manhattan and New Jersey will only add to logistical challenges, demanding cooperation between more than 100 law enforcement agencies across state lines.

headline.main: Puzzle of Super Bowl Security Has to Include New Pieces
headline.print_headline: Security Puzzle Has to Include New Pieces

docs.snippet: Why football fans should root for a frigid and snowy Super Bowl....
docs.lead_paragraph: Why football fans should root for a frigid and snowy Super Bowl.
docs.abstract: Op-Ed article by former NFL player Nate Jackson welcomes snowy cold weather for February 2 Superbowl in East Rutherford, NJ, and encourages fans to do likewise; says extreme weather has leveling effect on playing field, nullifying careful game planning and leaving only the game and talented players in place.

docs.snippet: The Giants’ offensive shake-up continued as their tight ends coach, Mike Pope, and their running backs coach, Jerald Ingram, were let go....
docs.lead_paragraph: The Giants’ offensive shake-up continued as their tight ends coach, Mike Pope, and their running backs coach, Jerald Ingram, were let go.
docs.abstract: NFL Roundup; New York Giants dismiss tight ends coach Mike Pope and running backs coach Jerald Ingram as part of continuing shake-up; other football news noted.

byline.original: By BILL PENNINGTON and BEN SHPIGEL

docs.snippet: A stretch of Broadway in Manhattan will be transformed into Super Bowl Boulevard, creating concerns in addition to those about security at the game itself....

docs.snippet: Connecticut police have searched a car looking for evidence that could link ex-National Football League star Aaron Hernandez, who is awaiting trial on a 2013 murder, with an unsolved 2012 drive-by shooting in Boston, local media reported on Thursd...
docs.lead_paragraph: Connecticut police have searched a car looking for evidence that could link ex-National Football League star Aaron Hernandez, who is awaiting trial on a 2013 murder, with an unsolved 2012 drive-by shooting in Boston, local media reported on Thursday.

headline.main: Connecticut Police Seek Evidence Tying Ex-NFL Star to 2012 Slayings: Reports
headline.print_headline: Connecticut Police Seek Evidence Tying Ex-NFL Star to 2012 Slayings: Reports
